attributes.action: Change the law to clarify election expenses and end the current controversy.
attributes.background:
The government should end the current controversy over allegations of electoral fraud by changing the law such that the rules are made unambiguous.
If the party in question apologises for the mistake and the affected members step down there should be no need for expensive investigations.
attributes.additional_details:
Either this issue stems from an honest mistake or it does not.
If it is an honest mistake then the only reasonable course of action is to own up and try to set it straight.
If it is not an honest mistake, then it appears to be a callous and calculated plot perpetrated by a corruption that runs through the heart of the party.

attributes.action: Increased pay for nurses, support workers and doctors in the NHS of 20% minimum
attributes.background: Last summer I was admitted to an adolescent psychiatric ward. My admission went on to last eight months and I have made tremendous progress in ways that I couldn't have foreseen in those first few days and months but I couldn't have done it without the incredible support network off staff!
attributes.additional_details: Less than a year on,i'm in college and aim to be back in full time education in September. I also have a part time job and I'm now providing for myself at 16 years of age. I am amazed at how the staff always responded calmly to fellow patients regardless of how much we might have tested their patience. I am inspired by their ability to stay calm in stressful situations. I appreciate the long and hard hours they put in to ensure other people's well being for a ridiculous excuse of a salary.

attributes.action:
Petition Minister of Health -
Establish Hospice Suites in NHS Hospitals
attributes.background: The current Office of National Statistics survey of End of Life Care, ‘Voices’, shows 96% of the dying strongly prefer home care or some more private and congenial place to die than the wards of a Hospital. Only 3% prefer Hospital yet half of deaths annually in England will occur on the wards.
attributes.additional_details:
Hospice care is the ‘centre of excellence’ for palliative care but most of us will die on the wards. We could have privacy, dignity and specialised care in Hospice Suites requiring reorganisation rather than more resources to establish.  

A recent Select Committee hearing had an NHS spokesman claiming this provision would reduce the skills of generalist Nurses and Doctors,  as if patients exist only to provide practical experience for medical staff. The dying should enjoy the best we can provide.

attributes.action: Remove hereditary peers from the House of Lords
attributes.background: The time has come to remove an outdated oddity from Parliament. There is no place for peers who gain their positions simply by being born into them. This is the logical step needed to finish the reforms of 1999.

attributes.action: Make schools provide more support for left handed children learning to write
attributes.background: Schools are equipped for right handed children. Items such as workbooks are not helpful. At such an important time in their development, not having specific support can knock their confidence. For example work books set out so that their writing hand is not covering the words they are copying.
attributes.additional_details: I have two left handed children and a left handed brother.  They struggle to use simple things because they live in a right handed world.

attributes.action: Change war pension deductions to benefits
attributes.background: Soldiers/veterans injured receive say £71.00 per week and claims ESA the DWP only allow £10 and take the rest away. This is compensation given due to injury and to have it removed when others on DLA are not effected or those on Universal Credits are not effected but those still on ESA suffer.
attributes.additional_details:
To The Rt Hon Stephan Crabb MP
 I would like to have the inconsistencies addressed for war disablement pension to be disregarded altogether as income as this is compensation awarded to the injured party and not a standard pension or income. All these issues have been addressed under the new universal credit scheme and is now left to a 'postcode lottery' as to whether our war veterans are put in hardship or not.

attributes.action: Change to (CCRs) Regulations 2013 to an prevent online fraud
attributes.background: There is loop hole being exploited by a small number of online buyers, where if the seller cannot prove delivery (ie sent WITHOUT ONLINE TRACKING) the buyer claims non-delivery getting money back and the goods (theft). This is costing traders a small fortune in claims.
attributes.additional_details: What I propose is if the seller offers a tracking service and the buyer declines that service, then the risk should pass from the seller to the buyer (PROVIDING THE SELLER CAN PROVE DISPATCH. ie Royal Mail Certificate of posting) and no claims will be accepted for non-delivery. This will make no difference for goods damaged in transit claims.

attributes.action: Strip First Group as franchise holders of Great Western Railways
attributes.background: General contempt for passengers' needs and woeful strategy in times of difficulty. Relaxed attitude to cancellations and delays.  Timetable relaxation to suit GWR.
attributes.additional_details: Journey times from Wiltshire are broadly 20% longer and tickets broadly 80% dearer than just over a decade ago.  Car park costs doubled.  Cancellations and delays are frequent. Limited conpensation for season ticket holders and GWR are past masters at making it difficult to claim. General contempt for the people they are supposed to serve.

attributes.action: Extra bank holiday for the Queen's birthday as we had an extra day in February.
attributes.background: As we had an extra day in February, I think we should get an extra bank holiday to help celebrate the Queens birthday on the 10th of June.

attributes.action: Allow transgendered people to begin hormone treatment from the age of 16.
attributes.background: Many people realise they are transgender in the early stages of their life but aren't allowed to begging transitioning into the opposite gender until the age of 18.

attributes.action: Allow parents to supervise a child fishing without having to purchase a licence.
attributes.background: The current rules for fishing licence is that a child under 12 needs doesn't need a licence but if they of a young age and require help holding a rod the person helping has to have a licence or they can face a £2000 fine

attributes.action: Include Menstrual Cups and Reusable Sanitary Towels in Free Prescriptions.
attributes.background: why not prescribe diva/moon/menstrual cups or washable Sanitary Towels to the low income which would be covered under the free prescriptions right? it would be cheaper in the long run for the government and the diva cup is a lot more beneficial for your health.
attributes.additional_details:
A food bank has started a campaign urging the government to make tampons free after women confessed to using old socks, handkerchiefs, and even scrunched-up newspapers instead. - Fiona Rutherford Buzzfeed news.
“Most women confessed to regularly getting infections resulting in prescriptions for antibiotics and in some cases hospital treatment,” - Major Colin Bradshaw
#beggingforaTAMPON

attributes.action: Make the term "Engineer" a legally protected designation.
attributes.background: Engineering as a profession is popularly confused in the UK with such occupations as plumbers, mechanics and fitters. This gives it both a lower status than it deserves and an unwarranted gender bias. This results in the UK having the lowest proportion of females in engineering in the whole OECD.
attributes.additional_details:
There is already a severe shortage of graduate-level engineers and this is predicted to worsen. Many people are put off engineering at school, either because they (or their teachers) do not see it as a career for the academically gifted. In most of the developed world, it has a status closer to that of medicine and a correspondingly higher participation rate of females, ~30%, vs 7% in the UK.  

IPPR 2014: Women in Engineering (2014)
Professor John Perkins' Review of Engineering Skills (2013)

attributes.action: Increase Police funding to proactively tackle driveway car thefts.
attributes.background: Everyday you read about someone who has had their car stolen from their driveway. Police numbers have reduced to merely providing a reactive approach to this. Having your vehicle stolen is in inconvenient and unfair. We, (You) deserve better. Sign now to get this debated and funding increased.

attributes.action: Introduce Sexual Abuse Awareness and Prevention into the Education system
attributes.background: Only 1 in 8 children who are sexually abused in the UK are identified by professionals.  It is estimated that as many as 450,000 children were abused over the same period of this study, but only 1 in 8 received the vital intervention needed to keep them safe and help to overcome their experiences
attributes.additional_details:
http://bit.ly/1RtqB4L
Almost every child goes to school, it is a place where professionals can share awareness and prevention education that will not only gently encourage the hundreds of thousands of children suffering in silence to receive vital intervention but also make children aware of the dangers of being groomed.
A different strategy needs to be adopted to ensure a different outcome. It is shocking that in 2016 children are still vulnerable in this way.

attributes.action: Call for EU sanctions against Denmark until whaling is stopped in Faroe Islands
attributes.background: The Faeroe islands kill hundreds of whales and dolphins every year. The rest of the world, apart from Japan, have put whaling behind them. The Danish government are allowing whaling to continue and even supporting it through military action. The pointless murder of whale and dolphins must be stopped
attributes.additional_details:
Check out the UK Government IWC document from 2008
Check out Sea Shepherd conservation society

attributes.action: Increase government funding for mental health especially in the young
attributes.background: Mental health services have been suffering with cuts year after year, until we are now ultimately in a 'mental health crisis', so many people are suffering and nothing is being done. Our government promised us more funding and we are yet to see the action. Mental health can affect everyone.

attributes.action: Remove the EU flag from UK driving licenses and V5 documents as soon as possible
attributes.background: The UK is now in the process of leaving the EU. It is therefore unnecessary and wrong to have important UK legal documents displaying the EU flag. Along with having a blue UK passport; UK driving licenses and V5 documents should display the Union Jack instead of the EU flag.

attributes.action: Extend the 'Aiming High for Young People' Plan
attributes.background: The 'Aiming High for Young People Plan' provides young people with funding and comfort, as well as an escape for troubled kids. Without the appropriate places for young people to stay off the streets, crime has statistically increased in these areas.
attributes.additional_details: By next year, the government will stop providing a place of comfort for young people in every consistentuency, the government will stop providing £25 million for teenagers in disadvantaged communities, and the government will stop providing young people influence over local authority funding. This needs to be changed. We, as gatekeepers for the next generation, must make sure the youth develop with the optimum funding and appreciation. The futures of millions of children holds in the balance.

attributes.action: Close all faith schools immediately and make a more harmoneous population !.
attributes.background: Our children are the future but in this world of uncertainty and hurt we seem to encourage it by allowing faith schools to propagate . This is wrong and now more than ever ! we need to make certain that our children's future is secure and free from hate and prejudice...
attributes.additional_details: I was educated in a catholic school .... But my mum was a catholic and my dad was a prodestant and neither cared about religion !! Which is how it should be .....I realised early on that we are all the same and at this early age we have the chance to guarantee the same future for our children and our children's children ....but we need to mix all the kids together and let them experience thus for themselves and we need to do it now !!....not tomorrow or the next day but now ...today

attributes.action: Ensure UK-EU Brexit deal retains our "passporting" rights in financial services
attributes.background: If we lose passporting rights in financial services due to Brexit it could be very damaging for the UK economy as firms re-locate activities to financial centres in the EU; this key issue has been largely ignored by politicians and this petition gives citizens a voice to help protect our economy

attributes.action: Introduce a jury system so family's fighting forced adoption have a fair trial
attributes.background: Fighting social services on forced adoption, give families a fair say and the options to explore every solution on earth to make changes to keep families together.
attributes.additional_details: Adoption is so final and social services play God with children's lives forced adoption is barbaric

attributes.action: Mandate our EU representatives veto further EU expansion instead of Brexit
attributes.background: Much of the leave campaign support seemed to surround the potential for Turkey and other countries joining the EU. Rather than leaving the EU, we should mandate that we use our power of veto to ensure that this does not happen.
attributes.additional_details: I have watched countless TV programmes interviewing the supporters and voters of the leave  campaign. This appears to be the main issue, with many saying that the migrants that are here should be allowed to stay. By mandating our power of veto, this would facilitate the UK staying in the EU, with the benefits it brings and stop the EU from expanding by increasing the member countries.

attributes.action: The Queen should be asked to stop Art 50 being invoked because of the referendum
attributes.background: In the light of the threat to the integrity of her United Kingdom and the narrowness of the vote, Members of Parliament should request that Her Majesty the Queen use the powers invested in her to ensure that Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty is not invoked on the basis of the June 23rd referendum.
attributes.additional_details:
The narrow victory for Leave in the recent referendum, and the likelihood that initiating Article 50 will lead to the break-up of the United Kingdom, leave the UK in a very difficult position. Political parties are in chaos. 
The Queen has the power to stabilise the United Kingdom and it would help if she were advised to do so by Parliament.

attributes.action: Ban the use of "committed suicide" by public bodies or in any official context.
attributes.background: My Grandfather ended his own life 11 years ago, for reasons we will never know. My Grandmother never recovered from both finding him after he had passed, but more so the stigma attached to the way in which he died. Suicide isn't a crime, and the term 'committed' should cease to be used in reference.
attributes.additional_details: There was a similar petition to this which recently gained over 2000 signatures, but this has since become inactive due to it being on here for more than six months and failing to obtain 10,000 signatures. I am doing several charity events to raise money for the SOBS charity who help those left behind following death by suicide, and I would like to reignite this petition, gaining enough signatures for this issue to be seen and considered in parliament.

attributes.action: Make It A Legal Requirement To Scan All Cats For A Microchip
attributes.background: My Portia went missing 9 weeks ago and no one has handed her in. Someone must have taken her, thinking she was a stray. Maybe they don't know she's missing, but this is why I want this law in place. I am heartbroken and so are other owners who are missing their cats.
attributes.additional_details: Many cats are taken in, believed to be strays and are never taken to the vets to see if the animal has an owner first.

attributes.action: Divert the £4,000,000 spent on Homeopathy to a Mental Health Awareness Campaign.
attributes.background: Every year, the NHS spends around £4 to £5 million on Homeopathy, a remedial pratice which has been repeatedly examined and found to have no long term health benefit other than placebo. This money could find better use as a national mental health awareness campaign to help curtail MH stigmatisation.
attributes.additional_details:
A 2010 review into homeopathy found that it was a 'placebo treatment'.
http://www.parliament.uk/business/committees/committees-archive/science-technology/s-t-homeopathy-inquiry/

This is an example of a mental health campaign which could be better funded with the extra money available from ceasing to fund homeopathy.
http://www.time-to-change.org.uk/

attributes.action: If Brexit happens. All previous EU spending should be forced to go to the NHS.
attributes.background: The Leave campaign made promises that the money spent in the EU would go to the NHS. They should be forced to up keep that promise.

attributes.action: No general election until after Brexit
attributes.background: We call on the next Tory leader not to call a general election and concentrate on brexit and make the divorce from the EU smooth as possible

attributes.action: Make Blue Badges Available to People With Mental Health Conditions.
attributes.background:
Under current regulations mental health conditions such as agoraphobia, anxiety and panic disorder are not accepted as valid reasons for needing a Blue Badge.
These conditions can be equally and sometimes more debilitating than a physical disability and it is discriminatory to exclude them.
attributes.additional_details:
Blue Badges, which allow people with certain disabilities to park closer to services, are only available to those with a physical disability. Those suffering from the above conditions are not able to apply for a badge unless they receive the higher rate of the mobility component of DLA.
The exception is if a person is unable to follow a familiar route without aid.
Mental health conditions can affect mobility and be extremely disabling, preventing a full life. Blue Badges could help with this.

attributes.action: All school meals in the UK to be planned and supervised by a nutritionist
attributes.background: Better nutrition for our kids needs to be a priority. Nutrition is the very foundation for a healthy life. Hungry kids tend not to pay attention during class, lack focus and affects their moods.
attributes.additional_details: Example, Finland one of the best education systems in the world, is nutrition part of their success? http://www.oph.fi/download/47657_school_meals_in_finland.pdf

attributes.action: All pledges in democratic elections and referendums should be legally binding.
attributes.background: The recent EU referendum result is based upon a campaign of misinformation.  This is not democratic since the public are not being told the truth. All elections pledges should be clear and legally binding. Any politician found to be deliberately misleading the public should be convicted of fraud.

attributes.action: Schools to have the funding for a full time teaching assistant in every class.
attributes.background: To ensure that every child is supported in their education, every primary school should have the funding to employ a full time teaching assistant in every class. This would not be to fulfil administrative tasks but to support the learning of all children.

attributes.action: Make future UK referendum results require a majority of 60%
attributes.background: Referendums are called by the UK government on matters of major constitutional change. Any major change from the status quo should have the backing of at least 60% of those who vote in each referendum.
attributes.additional_details: Recent referendums have demonstrated the strongly devisive nature of proposed major changes to people's lives, especially when the result is close to an even split. Having to reach a qualified majority of 60% in any UK referendum would help ensure that changes are more widely accepted amongst the electorate.

attributes.action: Nationally standardise the colours of commercial and domestic rubbish bins.
attributes.background: Each council area has a different colour scheme for rubbish and recycling bins. This often adds to confusion over what can be recycled, and recyclable waste is often thrown away, or recyclable materials are often put in the incorrect bins.
attributes.additional_details:
The colour scheme would become second nature to people's views towards waste disposal. The colour scheme could even extend to public litter bins on the streets.

Whilst this process could take some time, it could be implemented in a phased way, as and when bins are scheduled for routine replacement.

attributes.action: Remove the titles Mrs, Miss and Ms from all government forms.
attributes.background: Titles for women are sexist and discriminatory, and provide marital status information about them that men do not have to divulge. Even having the Ms option gives some people a preconception about that person. All titles fields should be removed from document and computer forms.

attributes.action: Lower the Income Requirement for Spouse/Family Visas to UK from non EU Countries
attributes.background: The current income requirement for British citizens to bring their non-EU spouses to the UK is £18,600. According to the BBC, 50% of British Citizens do not earn enough to meet the new requirements. Britons earning minimum wage should have the right to a family. by basic human rights.
attributes.additional_details:
The High Courts suggested £13,000 ,above National Minimum Wage.Which, is being appealed by the Home Office as too low. Members of the EU with non-EU spouses aren't subjected to the same requirement. British citizens should not be punished for who they want to marry. 
The HS, Theresa May, said 'these current laws openly discriminate against the poor'.
Propose lowering the income requirement so that citizens working full-time(40 hours)on a minimum wage salary can be with their Spouses.

attributes.action:
In, out, or Sort it out?

Add a change the EU option to the referendum ballot.
attributes.background: The in out EU referendum is not providing the British people with the choice the majority wish to make. Life is not black or white it is grey. By far the majority of voters would, given the choice send a message of protest to the EU demanding reform.
attributes.additional_details:
The 'stay' and 'leave' camps both identify what is wrong with Europe, neither provide a clear vision, or model or plan to optimise Britain's relationship with it.

There is an overwhelming majority for change. The EU needs to hear the clear voice of Btritain.

attributes.action: Reform the House of Lords to become the revising chamber of devolved assemblies
attributes.background: To reform the House of Lords to become the revising chamber for every devolved Parliament and Assembly in the United Kingdom to promote good governance while reducing the future burden on the taxpayers of the Realm with unnecessary duplication across the nation.

attributes.action: Let all serving forces personnel grow a full beard.
attributes.background: Using the same guidelines as the Royal Navy, allow all serving personnel for all UK forces to grow and maintain a beard.

attributes.action: Stop UK Gap Year travel companies placing volunteers in orphanages abroad.
attributes.background:
1. 80% of children in homes in Asia and Africa are NOT orphans.
2. Short-term volunteers disrupt the welfare of the children.
3. It is illegal in many countries to volunteer on a Visitor's Visa.
4. Many orphanages force children to convert from their family religion in return support.
attributes.additional_details:
These conditions violate the terms of the UN Convention on the Rights of the Child to a home, family, community, religion.
http://www.nextgenerationnepal.org/File/The-Paradox-of-Orphanage-Volunteering.pdf
http://globalsl.org/why-unicef-and-save-the-children-are-against-you-caring-for-orphans/
http://www.theguardian.com/world/2014/jan/02/cambodia-child-protection-workers-call-for-end-to-booming-orphanage-tourism
http://www.theguardian.com/global-development-professionals-network/2016/may/16/volunteers-stop-visiting-orphanages-start-preserving-families

attributes.action: Tougher consequences for Domestic Abuse including mental and financial abuse.
attributes.background: Domestic Abuse is looked upon as mostly solely physical abuse in society, and this needs to change. It needs to be made publicly aware that it's more than just physical, including mental and financial. This can impact a victims life as much as phsyical, and should hold a higher sentence for all.
attributes.additional_details: There should be higher consequences for all aspects of domestic abuse including an automatic 2 year restraining order for anyone found guilty of causing Domestic abuse. This will resolve further issues including harassment and stalking preventing further abuse. A domestic Abuse list should be created to protect victims who suffered the abuse. Mental and financial abuse should be thoroughly investigated having the same consequences as phsyical. These consequences should prevent abuse re-occuring

attributes.action: Make it illegal to set up camp on public or private land without permission
attributes.background: In Newport gypsies set up camp with 14 caravans and an array of luxury cars including two Mercedes, a BMW X6, and a Volkswagen, blocked hundreds of NHS staff from parking outside the hospital. Hospital spokesman Ms Hayman said legal advice was sought over how to eject them.
attributes.additional_details:
Can gypsies and travellers occupy any seemingly vacant land?
No, as mentioned above, they cannot simply occupy land because it is vacant, if it has not been designated for this purpose.
Gypsies or travellers should contact the local authority in the area in which they wish to camp to find out whether there is any space for them on a permanent, or temporary site.

attributes.action: Give 100% tax relief on pensions when care home costs exceed the pension income.
attributes.background: My elderly mother-in-law has Alzheimers Dementia and lives in a care home. Total pension income is around £16K PA.  Total care home costs are £33K and rising.  Why is it necessary to pay several thousand pounds income tax which erodes the reserves faster and will lead to her needing government help?
attributes.additional_details: There was a plan to cap the care costs but that has now been scrapped.  In any case it was not a true and honest capping but a sneaky way to make political capital out of addressing care costs without actually spending any money.  It would have benefited only a tiny minority. To allow large corporates to pay paltry amounts of tax whilst levying income tax on pensions paid to paupers is morally and ethically wrong and we should address this totally unjust state of affairs.

attributes.action: Stop 39 week waiting period for mortgage interest payments
attributes.background:
From 1/04/16 the government has implemented a 39 week waiting period for mortgage interest payment support. 
This means that people like myself who have always worked and paid into the system but now can not work through no fault of their own such as cancer risk losing their property
attributes.additional_details:
From 1 April 2016 the waiting period until you receive any payment will increase from 13 to 39 weeks for new claims.Reference DWP website
Support for Mortgage Interest (SMI) https://www.gov.uk/support-for-mortgage-interest/overview

attributes.action: Give the UK a Dutch style referendum vote on the Ukraine joining the EU.
attributes.background: The Dutch people have just been robbed by the EU officials, by having a 64% vote against the Ukraine joining, being completely ignored. Brussels have said that the Ukraine deserve to join as they have met their targets and so the Dutch people are incorrect in thier view and opinion.

attributes.action: Educate and enforce pornography awareness in schools
attributes.background: I believe adolescents need to be educated on how pornography can affect their emotional and physical state. Many young people are viewing it without knowledge or awareness of how it could be harming them or others.This generation have a right to know the dangers of porn addiction and abuse.
attributes.additional_details:
http://fightthenewdrug.org/

http://www.roadtograce.net/current-porn-statistics/

http://yourbrainonporn.com/physiological-and-psychological-effects-modern-day-pornography-2013

http://www.webroot.com/gb/en/home/resources/tips/digital-family-life/internet-pornography-by-the-numbers

attributes.action: Make people who are Specials not have to complete a CKP to join as a constable.
attributes.background:
Specials work as police officers for free.

However to join and get a fulltime job we have to spend £750+ on a course that teaches us everything we already know.

If specials have been doing the role, Do we really need to do an entry level course to teach us the basic knowledge of policing
attributes.additional_details:
The collage of policing charge huge amounts of money for the course, which doesnt even gaurentee you a job. 

Specials are already trusted by the force to go out on their own and do they job, so why do they have to pay for a course when they already know it all?

attributes.action: I want every Cancer Survivor to be given a Long Term comprehensive Care Package
attributes.background: Failure to manage Consequences of Cancer Treatment effectively, long term, compromises survival, quality of life, recovery and patient experience. In addition the economy is impacted, through people being unable to return to work or education.  Mental Health is not being addressed
attributes.additional_details: Statistics show 1 in 2 of us will get a Cancer diagnosis, and at least 500,000 people in the UK are facing poor health or disability after treatment for cancer – that’s 25% of people who have already had a cancer diagnosis. Commissioners discriminate because complex needs include co-morbidities which are not recognised by the Private Service Providers.   The National Health Service was created to ensure no one slipped through the net and received joined up Care from Cradle to Grave.

attributes.action: stop ALL benefit cuts.
attributes.background:
the government is again planning to cut benefits... across the board. this is wrong. these benefits are needed to survive. too many are being forced to use food banks.
the government is pushing thousands into poverty. and most are already there. vote to stop this.  take action.
